Articles.Content:
![RetroRocketry.png~original](http://i814.photobucket.com/albums/zz68/nicolarre/RetroRocketry.png~original)

Right after buying the retail version, i tried my hand at making a KSP mod based on Retro-futurism / art deco style rockets.

I made only a handful of parts (incomplete parts, no UVs/textures) before i dropped it. Mostly because browsing throught the mods list i found most mods here tend to be geared toward more "serious" space exploration. Also, the retro style of rockets don't work so well when multiple stages are involved.

I might continue the mod if there's anyone interested in retro rockets. I also take suggestions.

So, Yay or Nay?

![Full50.jpg~original](http://i814.photobucket.com/albums/zz68/nicolarre/Full50.jpg~original)
Honestly, this isn't the best idea, especially considering that multiple stages don't work that well with this style of parts.

You really should continue ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Those models look really great, and here's the proof that retro rockets and staging can match [http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_mRSGfmWujA0/TKA17u3S9sI/AAAAAAAAF0w/c_N77WNmqhA/s1600/68774-050-0DD2C3D2.jpg](https://3.bp.blogspot.com/_mRSGfmWujA0/TKA17u3S9sI/AAAAAAAAF0w/c_N77WNmqhA/s1600/68774-050-0DD2C3D2.jpg) 

Nice designs, some looks right out from toy story ahah. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I don't personally like the design of the parts. Would they work? Certainly, but I don't know how many people would use them.

Whoville Rockets!! Just kidding. Ok, I'm not. That's what popped in my mind. Rockets designed by Dr. Seuss. But I don't mean that in the negative. I can't model worth a darn. You clearly can. So if you like what you're doing, then go ahead. I'm guessing that serious players occasionally like the whimsical or 1920's vision of rockets.
I put my hat in for yay. Do it, there might be a niche appeal.
while I personally am not a fan of retro style parts, I am sure many people here will find this interesting, so go for it!
My ten-year old self is in love with these! There's a very Disney/vintage sci-fi vibe that I really like. It would be interesting to see where you go with these designs. Flying them would be fun!

As a great fan of the Art Deco/Raygun Gothic style (I use it myself while wearing my writer hat), I would fly the hell out of these parts! Continue, please!

-c
This keeps reminding me of the stuff from Spore. XD

Not gonna lie, came here for this:

![spacexland.jpg](http://cnet2.cbsistatic.com/hub/i/r/2014/05/30/3fd6c398-c50e-4867-9d2b-95df9edb475a/resize/770x578/ab872f6bcdc456ffab3b023f26dbdd2d/spacexland.jpg)

But hey, I'm not gonna tell you to abandon your mod. Go for it. Yay.
I've been thinking up a contract pack scenario that would involve locating alien artifacts that would in turn reveal secret tech tree nodes. Parts like these would be ideal for that project.
yes, please continue. This has a lot of potential!

Idea of retro rockets is nice, but you shoudl go for a little more realistyc design.

Your models mostly look like from 50' comic book, maybe try to imitate early Von Braun designs.

Here are some reference materials:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Zjs3nBfyIwM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/KeRaAFw5a5I?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0sVBm86S5_E?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[http://dreamsofspace.blogspot.com/2012/03/colliers-march-22-1952-man-will-conquer.html](https://dreamsofspace.blogspot.com/2012/03/colliers-march-22-1952-man-will-conquer.html)

> 
> I've been thinking up a contract pack scenario that would involve locating alien artifacts that would in turn reveal secret tech tree nodes. Parts like these would be ideal for that project.

That's a great idea ! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Humorous parts like these don't last for very long in my experience. The models look technically very good though.
